Articles.Content:
Female Kerbals don't have tongues.

![CB37lrOUsAAoQ7o.jpg](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/CB37lrOUsAAoQ7o.jpg)

But male kerbals do.

What is this sorcery.
She looks scary. I still use 0.9, and now that picture ...

> 
> probably an oversight, but imagine the silence...

True its not an bug but an feature ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-08T03:11:31Z" title="05/08/2015 03:11  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 8, 2015</time> by shadowsutekh**
  
removed objectionable content from quote

Lol, you're right, they don't. wierd.

Strange oversight.
Now I'm suddenly wondering if this is going to get more priority in the next hotfix than the memory leak xD

> 
> lol people notice the dumbest things in this game. I can think of an a few extremely inappropriate reasons why it would be more beneficial for a male Kerbal to have a tongue and the female does not...

Because males like ice cream more?

> 
> Because males like ice cream more?

What kind of ice cream? Now that's the question.

[Removed]

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-09T15:13:46Z" title="05/09/2015 03:13  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 9, 2015</time> by sal\_vager**

> 
> [Removed]

I'm glad something funny finally came out of it.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-09T15:13:32Z" title="05/09/2015 03:13  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 9, 2015</time> by sal\_vager**

Perhaps the Hitchhiker's Guide to Kerbals can shed some light on this mystery! ...Hmm... Apparently that's not actually a tongue that male Kerbals have. It's not even part of their bodies, in fact. Male Kerbals like to stick ping-pong-paddle-like devices in their mouths during launches so they have something cool to rattle around while screaming. Female Kerbals are generally more mature than that. Well then!
Please keep objectionable content out of threads like this.
This got... dark... quickly.

So, I imagine that this has to do with Kerbal evolution. Since, it has been proposed in past discussions, that Kerbals could be amphibian.... it would make sense that the males have more of a 'voice', as IRL male frogs are the ones who sing.

Also, on the main menu with the Kerbals in orbit around Kerbin, the 3 male Kerbals have the yellow glass on their helmets:

[![8dq4Davl.png](http://i.imgur.com/8dq4Davl.png)](http://i.imgur.com/8dq4Dav.png)

while the female (Valentina?) doesn't:

[![RCcHlYkl.png](http://i.imgur.com/RCcHlYkl.png)](http://i.imgur.com/RCcHlYk.png)

Seems kinda pointless to wear a helmet in a vacuum with a huge hole at the front where the glass should be, eh?

I think...

I think that female kerbals are actually not kerbals.

Perhaps they were genetically designed at the RnD, and some stuff went wrong, making them tongueless and resistant to vacuum?

> 
> [Removed]

Uh...

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-09T15:10:30Z" title="05/09/2015 03:10  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 9, 2015</time> by sal\_vager**
Hmm, this finding may have implications for the Chatterer mod, which (as I understand it) now features female as well as male voices.

What tongues?

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/lznnb)
IVA male kerbals have tongues, whereas IVA female kerbals don't. Make a male kerbal smile in IVA and you'll see.

> 
> Because males like ice cream more?

They just prefer their ice cream in a cone whereas the female kerbals like to eat it out of a bowl.
Sound doesn't travel in a vacuum.. so there's no point.. . . . . ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

> 
> Seems kinda pointless to wear a helmet in a vacuum with a huge hole at the front where the glass should be, eh?

Maybe that explains why she looks so pale and lifeless...
Psss, they are aliens and that is not really a tong. O.o

> 
> Perhaps the Hitchhiker's Guide to Kerbals can shed some light on this mystery! ...Hmm... Apparently that's not actually a tongue that male Kerbals have. It's not even part of their bodies, in fact. Male Kerbals like to stick ping-pong-paddle-like devices in their mouths during launches so they have something cool to rattle around while screaming. Female Kerbals are generally more mature than that. Well then!

I thought that's how they managed to keep both hands on the controls and simultaneously hold onto their rocks-on-strings for timing burns?

Hm. Female tourists have tongues. I just started career, and I'm taking up a male & a female tourist and they were both panting like dogs and completely freaking out. I don't think I'm getting repeat business there.
